result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laron Chaz Thomas

defendant.name: Thomas, Laron Chaz
defendant.address: 1402 Royalton St., c/o Waupaca County Jail, Waupaca, WI 54981

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Matter set for a PTC on 11/14/2022 at 10:00 a.m.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.
Atty Raabe stands mute to the pleas.
Court will enter not guilty pleas.
State is in compliance with victim rights notification.
No victim(s) appear today.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:24 PM Defendant Laron Chaz Thomas appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney Jessica Phelps in court for Laron Chaz Thomas.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Laron Chaz Thomas.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.

3:25 p.m.  Officer J Klein is sworn in.
3:26 p.m.  Direct examination by ADA Dodge.
Atty Raabe puts an objection on the record.
ADA Dodge does not believe an objection is appropriate at this time.
BY THE COURT: 
Objection is overruled.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear via ZOOM and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with his attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.

3:33 p.m.  ADA Dodge continues his direct examination.
3:38 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
ADA Dodge would ask that the record reflects that the witness has identified the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
The record so reflects the identification.
3:39 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Raabe.
3:44 p.m.  ADA Dodge has no redirect.
Witness is excused.
ADA Dodge has no further witnesses.
Atty Raabe has no witnesses.
Neither party has any final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No contact with the victim(s)

2:03 PM Defendant Laron Chaz Thomas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jessica Phelps in court for Laron Chaz Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Jessica Phelps and Atty Adam Raabe appointed
